Description: Fragment of lid of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: band of tongues between dilute lines around knob (now lost); on lid, black-figure decoration consisting of animals to right, lion (head and neck remaining; added red on face), and rump, haunch and tail of second lion or sphinx, with red on underbelly; pendant rosettes and dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2093) (phase 2)
